subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
[[File:Solid kurenai.svg|thumb|150px|{{lang|ja|紅}} (''kurenai'', ''beni'', ''kō''): hexadecimal color code #D71345]] [[File:Safflower.jpg|thumb|150px|{{lang|ja|紅}} (''kurenai'', ''beni''): the [[safflower]], ''Carthamus tinctorius'']]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くれない}} {{IPAfont|⟨kure no2 awi⟩}} → {{IPAchar|/kurenawi/}} → {{IPAchar|/kurenai/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=くれない|-}}. Shift from {{m|ja|呉の藍|tr=Kure no ai}}:{{R:Daijisen}} {{compound|ja|sort=くれない|呉|tr1=Kure|t1=China|の|tr2=no|pos2=possessive particle|藍}} (''ai'', “[[indigo]]”: by extension, “[[dye]]”). The [[safflower]], from which the [[crimson]] dye was extracted, was brought to Japan from China.

subSections.title: Proper noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
[[File:DiorLippenstift.jpg|thumb|150px|{{lang|ja|紅}} (''beni''): [[lipstick]]]] [[File:2006_Mac_Limited_Edition_Patternmaker_POWDER_BLUSH.jpg|thumb|150px|{{lang|ja|紅}} (''beni''): [[rouge]]]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|べに}} {{IPAfont|*/peni/}} → {{IPAchar|/beni/}} First attested in ''{{w|The Pillow Book}}'', completed in 1002. Shift from *''heni'', attested in the ''{{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}'' (938 {{CE}}) with the original sense of "[[rouge]]". The ''ni'' is definitely {{m|ja|丹|tr=ni||[[red earth]], [[cinnabar]]}}, while the initial ''pe''/''be'' remains uncertain.
